items.title: Arteta 'hacked off' by Rice's time-wasting red card
items.summary: Mikel Arteta has revealed he was "hacked off" by Arsenal's draw with Brighton & Hove Albionlast season but hailed his side's improved disciplinary record this term.

items.title: Forest's 'greatest' John Robertson dies at 72
items.summary: Former Nottingham Forest and Scotland winger John Robertson has died at the age of 72, the Premier League club have announced.

items.title: Slot needed to 'convince' Ekitike to reach best form
items.summary: Liverpool striker Hugo Ekitike's five goals in four matches suggest he is starting to get to grips with the Premier League but head coach Arne Slot admits he had to push the player to reach his current levels.

items.title: Richards on U.S., Palace return: 'Won't be long'
items.summary: United States defender Chris Richards said it "won't be long" until he's back for Crystal Palace.

items.title: De Ierse succescoach die hogere doelen nastreeft
items.summary: In zijn bijna tien jaar als manager van Shamrock Rovers groeide Stephen Bradley (41) uit tot prijzenpakker, met de Ierse dubbel als recente toevoeging aan zijn palmares. Dit jaar viel Bradley nog meer op door zijn activiteiten buiten het voetbal. In het kerstnummer van VI uitgebreid aandacht voor het verhaal van de ex-prof uit Dublin, wiens zoontje Josh in 2022 op achtjarige leeftijd werd getroffen door leukemie.

items.title: Aanwezigheid zoontjes Jota maakt Liverpool - Wolves extra emotioneel
items.summary: De twee zoontjes van Diogo Jota zullen zaterdag het veld oplopen tijdens het op voorhand emotionele Premier League-duel tussen Liverpool en Wolverhampton Wanderers op Anfield, de twee oude clubs van hun vader. De BBC maakt hier vrijdag melding van, in navolging van The Times .

items.title: 'A huge risk!' | Should Birmingham have had a penalty against Derby?
items.summary: Birmingham's Marvin Ducksch is denied a penalty after Derby's Matt Clarke appears to bring down the forward inside the box.

items.title: Barcelona-sterren laten hun hart spreken tijdens de feestdagen
items.summary: De sterren van Barcelona hebben de kerstdagen gebruikt voor bijzondere activiteiten. Jules KoundÃ© en Lamine Yamal voetbalden met de lokale jeugd, terwijl Raphinha in BraziliÃ« hielp bij het uitdelen van cadeaus.

items.title: Arne Slot believes â€˜best is yet to comeâ€™ as Liverpool look to end set-piece failings
items.summary: â€˜Difference between us and other teams is too smallâ€™ Liverpool have conceded 11 league goals from set pieces Arne Slot has claimed Liverpool have much more to offer this season and can become the dominant team he envisaged, although only once their set-piece failings have been eradicated. Liverpool have stemmed a damaging sequence of nine losses in 12 games â€“ the clubâ€™s worst run in 71 years â€“ to climb to fifth in the Premier League, level with fourth-placed Chelsea. But Slot, who admits Liverpoolâ€™s position remains below expectations, insists he will not get carried away by an unbeaten run of six matches because the teamâ€™s performance level requires big improvement. Continue reading...

items.title: $1 tickets to NFL playoffs? Christmas has changed for Panthers
Cornervariant bij PSV als ultiem geluksmoment voor Telstar: 'Niet Ã©Ã©n keer geoefend'
items.summary: Een van de Telstar-hoogtepunten in het seizoen van de terugkeer op het hoogste niveau, was de uitoverwinning op regerend landskampioen PSV. Trainer Anthony Correia beleefde er zijn ultieme geluksmoment.

items.title: 'Respect the culture' - Fifa urged to allow Pride Match
items.summary: An official involved with the World Cup Pride Match says there has been no contact from Fifa about their plans, despite the Egyptian FA's complaint.

items.title: This will be the Premier League's quietest Boxing Day ever: Where did all the games go?
items.summary: The day after Christmas is usually jam-packed with great Premier League matchups, but not this year. What gives?

items.title: Havertz near to Arsenal return with Arteta hoping for â€˜different dimensionâ€™ in attack
items.summary: Forward underwent knee surgery in August Arteta: â€˜It will be a matter of days, not weeksâ€™ Mikel Arteta hopes Kai Havertz is ready to return from a long-term knee injury and has predicted the German will bring â€œa different dimensionâ€ to Arsenalâ€™s attack. Havertz has been sidelined since undergoing knee surgery in August and had been expected back at the start of December before a setback in his rehabilitation. The 26-year-old was Arsenalâ€™s top scorer in the Premier League last season with nine goals despite missing several months with a hamstring issue. He was pictured training this week and Arteta revealed Havertz had been â€œquite closeâ€ to being considered for the Carabao Cup quarter-final win over Crystal Palace on Tuesday. Continue reading...

items.title: Parma coach Carlos Cuesta: â€˜Leaving Arsenal was maybe the most difficult decision of my lifeâ€™
items.summary: Spaniard, who at 30 has been coaching for half his life, discusses Arteta, tactics and how to win playersâ€™ trust Carlos Cuesta, towards the end of his first major interview, briefly lets himself wonder how far his journey will take him. â€œMaybe one day it brings the Maldives,â€ he says with a laugh, the joke being football managers can quickly be banished from view, twiddling their thumbs on the beach, once their star has faded. Still, would that be so bad? â€œIt could be better or worse, it depends when or why. If itâ€™s because you want it, or if itâ€™s because somebody told you to go.â€ If soaking up rays sounds like anathema to Cuesta it is because, in a remarkable ascent, he has barely wasted a minute. In June, shortly before turning 30, he took the reins at Parma and became the youngest head coach in Serie A since 1939. Half of his short life had been spent building up to that moment, the realisation crystallising in his late teens that no other calling would do. â€œI felt that I needed to coach,â€ he says. â€œIt was like an inner necessity that I had inside of me.â€ Continue reading...

items.title: Birmingham chasing winner vs 10-man Derby | Boxing Day EFL on Sky LIVE!
The Next Sarina: maak kennis met de Nederlandse coach die de CL won
items.summary: Als 2025 voor iemand een bijzonder jaar is geworden is het wel voor RenÃ©e Slegers. De pas 36-jarige manager van de vrouwen van Arsenal wilde eigenlijk in de schaduw werken om te leren en ervaring op te doen, maar werd in januari benoemd tot hoofdcoach. In mei won ze de Champions League.

items.title: Jota's sons to join mascots for Liverpool v Wolves
items.summary: Diogo Jota's sons will accompany the matchday mascots as the Portuguese's two former sides - Liverpool and Wolves - meet for the first time since his death.

items.title: John Robertson was a â€˜scruffy, unfitâ€™ genius who did not get the kudos he deserved | Ewan Murray
items.summary: Forest great was loved in Nottingham but under-appreciated in Scotland before going on to thrive as a coach On the eve of a Celtic European tie 25 years ago, Stiliyan Petrov cut an increasingly agitated figure. The young midfielder, soon to shoot to prominence under Martin Oâ€™Neill, was finding it impossible to snatch the ball from a rotund, wizened coach during a possession drill. Petrovâ€™s teammates were cackling with laughter. John Robertsonâ€™s brilliance was understated enough in Scotland. Word of his talent in the game was never likely to reach Petrov as he grew up in deepest Bulgaria. Petrov is part of a recent generation who owe a debt of gratitude to Robertson the coach. More of them later. When news of Robertsonâ€™s death filtered through on Christmas Day, the prevailing sense was that his country had lost one of a kind. He was also an individual who, for reasons associated with his own modesty, really never received the kudos he deserved in the land of his birth. Continue reading...
